instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 00165 No Backlight. WD. L7701 - 8.5V. BKL_EN -2.8V. BKL_PWM -2.8V. FB - 0V.
threads.message:
Hello,

Backlight IC replaced.

L7701 - 8.5V

BKL_EN -2.8V

BKL_PWM -2.8V

FB - 0V

FB line is not broken. Have continuity.

Fuse is okay.

R7712-22 - 0 oHms. OL in diode mode.

Please advice how to proceed. Thank you!

threads.title: 00165 No Backlight. WD. L7701 - 8.5V. BKL_EN -2.8V. BKL_PWM -2.8V. FB - 0V.
threads.message:
Possibly bad solders at U7701.
Post diode mode to ground on all return resistors; with red probe on ground!
OL will mean bad solders...

threads.title: 00165 No Backlight. WD. L7701 - 8.5V. BKL_EN -2.8V. BKL_PWM -2.8V. FB - 0V.
threads.message:
OL on diode mode. Replaced U7701 again and still no BK and OL. Will let it R.i.P.
THanks for your help!

threads.title: 00165 No Backlight. WD. L7701 - 8.5V. BKL_EN -2.8V. BKL_PWM -2.8V. FB - 0V.
threads.message: You can ONLY have OL there in diode mode (red probe at ground) if U7701 is not soldered...
